author: Hans Wetzels and Remy Käller
description:
On a beach strewn with plastic and fish waste on the eastern side of the Senegalese capital Dakar, a lorry is being loaded up with small fish that have just been brought ashore in colourful wooden canoes. For generations, the daily catch in Dakar has been sold directly on the beach to women traders who […]

The post How farmed fish in Dutch supermarkets undermines food security in West Africa appeared first on DeSmog.
title: How farmed fish in Dutch supermarkets undermines food security in West Africa
